summary: An FBI request to the UK National Crime Agency for assistance in obtaining inbound and outbound travel records from the UK for Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell from approximately 1991 to the present. The document states the FBI is investigating Epstein for sex trafficking and sexual exploitation of underage girls, and Maxwell for facilitating the exploitation of minors.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the FBI investigation for sex trafficking and sexual exploitation of underage girls across the United States. The FBI is requesting his UK travel records.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Identified as an individual who helped facilitate the exploitation of minors and is under FBI investigation. The FBI is requesting her UK travel records.

connections.description: Both are subjects of the same FBI investigation into the sex trafficking and exploitation of minors, with Maxwell identified as helping to facilitate Epstein's activities.

events.title: FBI Travel Records Request to UK
events.description: The FBI formally requests the UK National Crime Agency's assistance in obtaining inbound and outbound travel records from the UK for Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

keyFacts: The FBI investigation is explicitly into Jeffrey Epstein for sex trafficking and sexual exploitation of underage girls across the United States.
Ghislaine Maxwell is identified as an individual who helped facilitate the exploitation of minors and is part of the same FBI investigation.
The FBI is seeking UK travel records for both Epstein and Maxwell covering a period from approximately 1991 to the present (April 2021).
The document lists multiple passport numbers and identification documents for both Epstein and Maxwell, including US, UK, and French passports.
The request is made under strict intelligence-sharing protocols, prohibiting the use of the information in legal proceedings without separate FBI authorization.
